history.content:
Yes, but note you ca only retake a class unless you get a grade of D+ or worse. So if your plan is to get a D (1.3) and then retake 61B to get an A (4.0), you need an A in both 61A and 70 ((1.3+4+4+4) / 4 = 13.3 / 4 = 3.3);  there is literally no margin for error. You must get a D, since a NP counts as a 0.0. It's much better to just go for the B-, B, B+, or A- that you're currently expected to get.

Look at @3105 for more information.

Moreover, I really think it is hard to intentionally ensure you get a D in the course (unless you are already in a position like that).

Hi, if I take CS61B and get some grade x, and then I retake CS61B and get a different score y, will my grade for the declaration cap be an average of (average of x and y + CS61A grade + CS70 grade) or is there some other policy?
history.subject: Declaring CS
